document_data.caption: ''A map showing the location of Reitheillaethor.''
document_data.name: Reitheillaethor
document_data.mainbody: '''Reitheillaethor''' or '''Rheitheillaethor''' ({{Pronounce|RHY|thigh|WAY|eh|thor}}) was a [[wood elf]] village located within the [[High Forest]] in [[the North]]. For some of its history it existed as a winter retreat for the forest's [[elves]], a place for them to take up seasonal residence before continuing their nomadic ways in the warmer months of the year. By the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]] however, it became part of something larger, one of the first communities of the High Forest that strove to revive a long-lost elven empire.
document_data.Description:
The village comprised numerous naturalistic buildings and shelters that appeared to grow out of the roots and trees of the forest floor. Seven outer structures encircled a central, white [[marble]] lodge built within the space formed by four great [[oak]] trees. 

Smaller, temporary shelters such as huts, lean-tos, and tents surrounded this prominent arrangement, The weirwoods of Reitheillaethor were magically protected against fire. 

The village boasted a sculpture carved by the famous [[stone giant]] artist [[Aris (giant)|Aris]], depicting [[human]]s and elves dancing together in celebration and glee.
document_data.Geography: It was situated on the bank of the [[Heartblood River]], just beyond the borders of the [[Dire Wood]] east of the ruins of [[Karse]].

Government.Relationships:
The elves of the village maintained an amiable relationship with the nearby [[treant]] community.

Guests of the elves were free to enter or leave the village as they wished, provided they did not endanger its safety in any way.

document_data.Trade: Reitheillaethor elves had the reputation as being expert hunters, foragers, fishers, and craftspeople. They were known to sculpt strong and highly sought-after [[clay]] pots that fetched a good price in local markets.
document_data.Defenses: In order to maintain its strong defenses, patrols were assigned to watch over the eastern reaches of the High Forest and keep watch over the nearby Dire Wood.
document_data.History:
As of the [[Era of Upheaval]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], Reitheillaethor was considered to be one of the elven peoples' youngest settlements within the High Forest.

On [[Ches 1]] in the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, Rheitheillaethor was attacked by [[daemonfey]] and [[orc]]s under their control. The combined forces overwhelmed the village's defenses and drove out its guardspeople.

As of the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], Lady Morgwais had united her village with those of [[Nordahaeril]] and [[Teuveamanthaar]] with the hopes of uniting all the tribes of the High Forest and restoring the kingdom of [[Eaerlann]].

Inhabitants.Notable Inhabitants:
* Lady [[Morgwais]], ruler of the village and the wood elves of the High Forest.
* Lady [[Jaementhe]], another authority figure.
* Captain [[Hulrune Silverbow]], leader of the guard.
* [[Gaerradh]], an elf ranger and scout in the High Forest.
* [[Fomoyn]], a xenophobic [[orc]]-hunter.
